title: Database Administrator
description:
StraCon Services Group, LLC is seeking a Full-Time, **Database Administrator** to join our team in supporting a Major Unmanned Aircraft Program at Naval Air Systems Command (NAVAIR), Patuxent River, MD. **Remote work is authorized**. The Successful candidates shall meet the minimum experience and education requirements and have demonstrated the necessary skills and experience to assist with the duties listed below:
**Essential Job Duties:**


* This position will support core working hours from 0830-1630 EST Monday through Friday.
* Install, configure, upgrade, and administer databases including SQL Server, Mongo, MySQL, and PostgreSQL.
* Ensure compliance to database DoD STIGs.
* Configure database backups in accordance with customer requirements.
* Perform database recoveries as required.
* Perform daily checks of databases, backups, exports, jobs, and storage.
* Troubleshoot databases, schemas, and user accounts.
* Other duties as assigned or required.

  




**Experience Requirements:**


* At Least three (3) - ten (10) years of experience performing database installations, configurations, and upgrades required.
* Experience performing database administration tasking with one or more of the following: Mongo, MySQL, or PostgreSQL required.

  

**Desired Experience:**


* Experience performing SQL Server database administration tasking desired.
* Experience with migrating existing databases to cloud-based (AWS) environments a plus.
* Experience working with Teamcenter/TcRA.

  

  

**Security Requirements:**


* U.S. Citizenship required.
* Active Secret/SSBI clearance desired or active Secret clearance with the ability to obtain and maintain Secret/SSBI.

  

  

**Education Requirements:**


* BS/BA degree and 3-10 years relevant experience OR HS Diploma and 5 years relevant experience.
* CompTIA Security+ Certification required (Must show proof prior to Interview).


**About StraCon:**  

StraCon is dedicated to supporting our government clients and warfighters by “Enhancing their Operational Capability”. With a proven track record, and an employee focused philosophy, we have developed a culture that believes in the talent of the individual. StraCon employees are empowered to “Make It Happen”. Since 2008, we have provided Program Management, Training Systems Products, Financial Management, Instructional System Design, Data Management, Courseware Development, Engineering, Logistics, Foreign Military Sales Support, and a variety other technical services for the Department of Defense.  

StraCon offers competitive benefits including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, accidental death and dismemberment, short/long-term disability, and 401(k) retirement plans, as well as a paid time off programs for eligible full-time employees. Eligible part-time employees are able to participate in the 401(k) retirement plans and may be eligible for state or contract required paid time off programs.
  

**StraCon is an Equal Opportunity & Affirmative Action Employer**

title: Oracle Database Administrator SSO
description:

title: Data Administrator
description:
**Job Summary:**

This position will collect data from primary or secondary sources and manage databases/data systems/ reports. Responsibility includes creating reports/dashboards, identifying, analyzing, and interpreting trends/ data.

**Responsibilities:**

Support Goals/OKRs (40%)

· Help teams design good goals and build them in Viva.

· Build Excel file with OKR data and connect to Viva.

· Follow up with colleagues throughout the quarter to ensure all OKRs are being updated.

Salesforce data support (50%)

· Run daily updates to accounts/contacts.

· Support building and scheduling Cadences and ensure BDCs have appropriate volume.

· Build reports/dashboards.

· Improve integrity of Salesforce data by researching important data points and merging duplicates

· Maintain territories, assign accounts within territories.

Power BI (10%)

· Maintain attrition reporting.

**Qualifications:**

· Bachelor’s degree in information technology, computer science, statistics, business administration, information management or any related field.

· 6 months to 1 year experience in preparing reports and analysis using different software.

· No prior experience with Viva, Salesforce, or Power BI is necessary but they should be skilled in Excel and generally be able to pick up technology quickly.

● Strong research, reporting, analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and communicate large volumes of information.

● Competent at raising inquiries, writing reports, and presenting results.

● Meticulous attention to detail and accuracy.

● Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

● Good communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.

**Requirement:**

· Have a stable internet connection, at least 35mbps, and have a backup connection.

· A conducive working environment at home. Must be away from noisy backgrounds and any kind of distraction.

* Amenable to working on shifting schedules, overtime, and during holidays. (Work schedules will depend on the local time zone of the US Client.) Approximately 8am-5pm US Central time zone (but it could shift 2 hours earlier or later if needed)

title: Database Analyst
description:
Hello

Greetings from Hanker Systems Inc!!!

Please go through the below requirement and let me know if you are comfortable with the position. Please send me your updated resume along with the best rate cap, visa status, and availability. Early response is appreciated.

**Job Title: Database Analyst**

**Location: Remote (Salem, Oregon)**

**Duration: 12 Months Contract**

**Description**

· The Office of Information Services (OIS) is a shared service provider for the Oregon Health Authority (OHA) and Department of Human Services (DHS). OIS provides the technology systems and services that support more than 18,000 OHA and DHS agency staff at local offices and facilities around the state. These systems and services help the two agencies determine client service program eligibility; provide medical, housing, food, and job assistance; provide addiction, mental health, vocational and rehabilitative services; protect children, seniors and people with physical and/or developmental disabilities; process claims and benefits; manage provider licensing and state hospital facilities; and promote and protect the state public health.

· The OIS Child Welfare Development Team seeks an experienced Database Analyst Level 4 with expertise in designing and developing Microsoft SQL Server data structures, optimizing interactions with and within the database (SQL, stored procedures, ETL, etc.), in accordance with business, data security and regulatory requirements as well as legislative mandates and court findings.

· This will work towards fulfilling the Child Welfare (CW) twelve-month plan items for 2024 and 2025 which support CW Transformation strategies including data quality initiatives and the emerging transition to data-oriented decision making in CW practice.

· Contractor’s Key Person will also work with various CW program areas and business teams to deliver strategic roadmap components to execute data modernization efforts, fulfill legislative mandates and comply with court findings.

**Scope:**

Contractor’s Key Person will provide expertise in the planning efforts to identify and modernize the agency’s data assets and to develop the future-state technical environment for CW.

**Tasks:**

· Comply with data security and access models.

· *Agile Software Development Process*

· *Requirements elicitation and specification in collaboration with non-technical Business Analysts and non-technical CW business program staff.*

· *Modernization initiatives targeting specific technology changes or generational changes in Federal program regulations.*

title: Database Administrator
description:
**Who we are:**


At QSR Automations, we set out each day to accomplish one thing: help restaurants create the ultimate guest experience. For over 26+ years we’ve been helping restaurants of all sizes all around the world. From kitchen automation to guest management solutions, our goal is to create and implement systems that make restaurants more efficient, more integrated, and more profitable.

**Our vision: Making service easier for everyone.**


QSR Automations is looking for a Database Administrator!

**Job Summary:**


QSR Automations has an immediate opening for the role for **Database Administrator** in Louisville, KY or hybrid/remote. This role will report directly to the Senior Manager of Infra and DevOps. This role manages and ensures the efficiency, security, and reliability of databases, coordinating with development and operations teams to streamline database-related processes and support continuous integration and delivery.

**What you will be doing:**

* Manage and maintain the organization's database systems, primarily focused on MySQL and Amazon Redshift.
* Implement and maintain database security measures to protect sensitive information.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to optimize database performance and ensure efficient data access.
* Design and implement database solutions in a cloud environment, with a preference for AWS experience and familiarity with RDS, Aurora, and Redshift.
* Troubleshoot and resolve database-related issues in a timely manner.
* Perform routine database maintenance tasks, such as backups, restores, and updates.
* Develop and implement database backup and recovery strategies to ensure data reliability and minimize downtime.
* Develop and implement data security policies, procedures, and best practices to protect sensitive information.
* Create and maintain comprehensive documentation of database systems, including schema, configurations, and standard operating procedures.
* Perform domain analysis to optimize database efficiency and reliability.
* Contribute to after-hours support for production issues (no on-call schedule).


What skills & experience you’ll bring to us:

**Required:**

* Proven experience as a Database Administrator with a focus on MySQL.
* Strong knowledge of database architecture, design, and performance optimization.
* Experience with cloud platforms, particularly AWS. Familiarity with Azure is a plus.
* Ability to design and implement efficient and scalable database solutions in a cloud environment.
* Solid understanding of database security best practices.
* Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.

**Desired:**

* AWS certification in Database-related services.
* Experience with other database systems (e.g., PostgreSQL).
* Familiarity with AWS Aurora and Redshift.
* Knowledge of scripting languages for automation tasks.
* Familiarity with automation tools in the cloud environment.

**What the role is:**

* Full-time, salaried position
* Regular M-F business hours. Plus some work outside of normal business hours will be required (Eastern Time Zone)
* Based out of our Louisville, Kentucky headquarters, hybrid (minimum 3 days in-office) if within proximity to office

**What we offer:**

* Competitive salary based on qualifications
* Performance based incentives
* Competitive benefits including medical, dental, vision and more!
* 401(k) with company match
* Company-paid short-term disability and group life insurance
* Casual work environment
* Dog friendly environment
* Great company culture

  

We offer competitive compensation, comprehensive benefits and programs that help our employees thrive in both their professional and personal lives.Our core values drive us to be successful.We are proud of our winning culture which is inclusive and respectful.We put people first.At QSR Automations we share a passion for our customers, we celebrate uniqueness and embrace fresh thinking. Don’t miss this great opportunity to join our team.

  

At QSR, we believe in Making Service Easier for Everyone. We understand the power of diversity and inclusivity in fueling creativity and driving innovation. By fostering an environment that values and supports the unique qualities of our employees, we create a vibrant palette of perspectives that leads to an abundance of fresh ideas. These diverse ideas, in turn, empower us to deliver exceptional solutions and outcomes. Together, we cultivate a culture where individuals can thrive and unleash their best work in an atmosphere of engagement and professionalism.

**Smarter restaurants need smarter people. Come join a SMARTER team!**

title: Database Administrator (Eastern Time Zone)
description:
**Job Purpose**

A Database Administrator is responsible for supporting the establishment, management, and maintenance of the configuration, integrity, and performance of databases hosted in Aptitude Cloud Service environments. This will be achieved through deploying various database tools and related processes, continuous monitoring, ongoing maintenance and response to database related issues. You are responsible for supporting the day to day database administration of Aptitude Cloud Service environments and consistently represent the Aptitude reputation.



As a key point of contact in Aptitude Cloud Service, you will mitigate risk by ensuring adherence to controls and security in all lifecycle phases. You will be expected to manage risk and think with a first-time right mindset as part of your decision-making process and with a sensitivity to client relations even when not directly client facing. You will adhere and proactively help to develop and document clear, repeatable, high-quality, and globally consistent cloud processes which create value and the best possible outcome for Aptitude and our clients. You are responsible for database administration of Aptitude Software Cloud Services environments and enabling them to meet client commitments and system requirements as they relate to database configuration, integrity, and performance.



A Database Administrator works as part of a global and diversified team and must accommodate cross time zone collaboration and client specific release windows with a flexibility in working hours. It is important to proactively cooperate and communicate with clarity directly with clients and across multiple Aptitude business units to deliver a best of breed Aptitude Cloud Service. This role requires consistent cooperation with product development, professional services, and support teams to resolve problems in a reliable way.



You should be mindful of the evolving company culture, celebrating milestones and ensuring that you contribute towards internal communications.  



  

#LIRemote

 **Skills & Requirements**

* Bachelor’s degree in information technology, computer science, or a related field.
* Minimum of 5 years of experience working with ORACLE database systems on UNIX and Linux.
* Provision, configure, maintain, and support single/multi-tenanted Oracle Standard & Enterprise Edition databases in Aptitude Cloud Service environments running on AWS RDS.
* Manage and coordinate Oracle database backups, clones, and disaster recovery events (RMAN) & procedures.
* Maintain and optimize Oracle database configuration, storage, and archival with a critical focus on performance management and cost savings.
* In-depth knowledge of query tuning using Explain plan, segment level tuning and server / database tuning using the AWR.
* Create and maintain technical documentation to ensure consistency.
* Ability to work independently and determine priorities of tasks as part of a geographically separated team.
* Flexibility in working hours to accommodate cross time zone collaboration and customer specific release windows.
* Perform Oracle database monitoring, manage user access, and support ticket resolution and reporting.
* Participate in on-call rotation to provide 24x7 support to production environments.

**Nice to haves**

* AWS Certification Associate Level or other Cloud Certification.
* Experience using OCI in combination with MS Azure.
* Familiar with the development and use of real-time computing engines such as Clickhouse.
* Experience with other database platforms including lesser-known RDBMS such as Postgres.

title: Cloud Database Administrator
description:
Synergy Business Innovation & Solutions is a premier implementer of cutting-edge software solutions. Synergy brings the experience and expertise necessary to deliver capability that provides tangible ROI to our customers. Synergy’s core areas of expertise are in the fields of Digital Transformation, Cloud Solutions, SaaS and Low-Code/No-Code solutions, Emerging Technologies, Data analytics and Visualization, Information Assurance, and Business Process Re-Engineering.

Synergy offers its employees a generous portfolio of core and voluntary benefits including group medical, dental, and vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k) with immediately vested company match, PTO/Sick Leave, 11 paid federal holidays, company paid life, short-term and long-term disability insurance, tuition and training reimbursement, fitness/wellness reimbursement, a referral bonus program, and life management programs.

At Synergy, you’ll be challenged and given the opportunity to grow in your career path. In fact, growth is such a big deal to us that you will have dedicated career coaches available for every employee, company-funded certification opportunities, education reimbursement, and a general open-door policy so that you have support when you need it. Our team is eager to learn, fast-paced, and quality-driven—if that sounds like you, Synergy has a position for you!

This position is designated as work-from-home. **Description*****:*** Oversees the SQL Database platform and possesses extensive experience and knowledge in:

* Develop and maintain automation scripts using PowerShell, Azure CLI, or other relevant tools to streamline administrative tasks.
* Implement and enforce security best practices for Azure databases.
* Provision and configure Azure database services, including SQL Database, SQL MI, Azure Database for PostgreSQL, etc.
* Implement and manage database backups, disaster recovery, and high availability solutions.
* Experience with performance tuning and optimization.
* Perform regular security assessments and vulnerability scans.
* Microsoft SQL Server (Knowledge of other database platforms preferred)
* SQL Server Availability Architecture, Always On Availability Groups, Failover Clusters, Replication, Mirroring, Disaster Recovery
* Process improvement, automation, monitoring and programming/scripting languages
* Cloud Architecture, Cloud Technologies, Cloud Services, Infrastructure as Code (Azure experience with Terraform preferred)
* Resource management and Service level agreements
* Maintain comprehensive documentation of database configurations, procedures, and best practices.
* Strong communication and teamwork abilities.
* 24x7 operations

**Skills, Qualifications and Certifications of Best Candidates:**

* Proven experience as a database administrator, with a focus on Azure cloud databases.
* Microsoft Azure certifications (e.g., Microsoft Certified: Azure Database Administrator Associate) are a plus.
* Proficiency in scripting and automation tools (e.g., PowerShell, Azure CLI).
* Advanced knowledge of networking concepts, object-oriented technology, data warehousing, and relational database engines.

Advanced proficiency in analytical, project planning, negotiating, interpersonal, and communication skills (written and oral).

**Citizenship or Work Authorization Required:** US Citizen

**Preferred Education & Experience:** >7 years of experience as a Data Architect, and a Bachelor of Arts/Science Degree in Computer Science or related field or an equivalent combination of education and/or experience, Master’s Degree preferred.

Compensation for roles at Synergy varies depending on a wide variety of factors including but not limited to the requirements of the role; education and certifications; knowledge, training, skills and abilities; level of experience; geographic location; and alignment with market data, law, and other business and organizational needs. As required by local law, the posted pay range represents the lowest to the highest pay that Synergy believes in good faith it might pay for this particular job, depending on the circumstances. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. It is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case.

title: Database Administrator OCC
description:
Abaco Strategy, LLC (Abaco) is an 8(a) Certified, HUBZone, Woman Owned, Small Business located in Leesburg, VA. Abaco provides Information Technology and Consulting Services to Commercial customers and the Federal Government. We deliver technology enabled, results oriented solutions. We build long term business relationships by ensuring the availability of highly skilled and certified resources providing a broad range of capabilities that meet the unique needs of all customers. We leverage industry best practices and business innovations to provide measurable results. We are seeking a DBA to support of our customer OCC to implement new workflow to accommodate primary security group requests as well as non-activity based secondary group requests.

**Responsibilities:**

* **Data Modeling and Design:** Design and implement effective database solutions and models to store and retrieve Appian product data
* **Data Management and Strategy:** Develop strategies for data sources, and implementation of a database structure
* **Data Security:** Work to ensure the consistent security of the organization's data by implementing appropriate access controls and data encryption methods
* **Performance Tuning:** Optimize database systems for performance efficiency
* **Integration:** Work closely with the Appian development team to integrate Appian products with existing databases, and to ensure that the applications can effectively use defined data structures
* **Collaboration:** Work with other IT team members and management to understand and define business needs and translate them into a data architecture framework that aligns with Appian's capabilities and best practices
* **Data Governance:** Establish rules, standards, and guidelines for data distribution to maintain data accuracy and security.
* **Strong OpenText Background.**

 **Specific Skills Required:**

* Strong understanding of SQL (MS SQL Server)
* Ability to write complex SQL queries.
* Ability to create and modifying various database objects such as stored procedures, views, tables, triggers using MS SQL Server
* Knowledge of database design principles including normalization, data integrity and indexing
* Strong analytical, problem-solving and critical thinking skills
* Strong written and oral communication skills
* 5 years SSIS experience

  

Abaco is an EOE/Affirmative Action Employer. We understand the value of diversity and its impact on a high-performance culture. Prospective employees will receive consideration without discrimination because of race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other legally protected status. We are a military friendly organization and veterans are encouraged to apply. Federal law requires all employers to verify the identity and eligibility of all persons hired to work in the United States.


As a HUBZone certified company, we encourage applicants who live in a HUBZone, as designated by the Small Business Administration (SBA). For more information visit the SBA HUBZone map

title: Database Administrator
description:
**Company Background:**


eVisit, headquartered in Mesa, AZ, is a telemedicine software company seeking to revolutionize healthcare delivery by creating physician-first tools that fundamentally simplify healthcare. Our HIPAA compliant telemedicine software was built for providers, by medical physicians, to optimize patient flow and boost practice revenue; while providing added convenience and high-quality care to patients, whether at work, home, or on the road.


eVisit is the fastest growing telemedicine software platform. The company is comprised of a unique team of talented individuals whose experiences are driven from backgrounds in healthcare and software development fields.

**Job Summary:**


The Database Administrator (DBA) and Developer is responsible for the performance, integrity, and security of databases. Additionally, this role will also involve in the development and optimization of database-related applications. This position requires a blend of database administration and development skills to support our organization's data management and software development needs.

 **Database Administration:**

* Install, configure, and maintain database management systems (DBMS).
* Monitor database performance, implement changes and apply new patches and versions when required.
* Ensure database security, integrity, stability, and system availability.
* Manage database access, develop and enforce database policies and procedures.
* Perform backup and recovery operations to prevent data loss.
* Assist in capacity planning, space management, and data maintenance activities.
* Database Development:
* Design and implement database schemas, tables, and relationships.
* Develop stored procedures, views, triggers, and other database objects.
* Work closely with application developers to integrate databases with applications and ensure data consistency and integrity.
* Optimize query performance, index tuning, and database optimization.
* Develop, manage, and test database backup and recovery plans.
* Participate in the development and deployment of data-driven applications.

**General:**

* Collaborate with IT team members to assess and meet the organization's data needs.
* Provide technical support for database issues encountered by users and application teams.
* Document database architectures, procedures, and processes.
* Stay updated with the latest database technologies, best practices, and industry trends.
* Conduct regular training sessions for users on data management and security practices.

**Requirements**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
* Proven experience as a DBA, database developer, or in a similar role.
* Strong knowledge of database structures, theories, principles, and practices.
* Proficiency in SQL and experience with at least one DBMS (e.g., MySQL, Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL).
* Experience with database design, documentation, and coding.
* Familiarity with data manipulation languages and the principles of database design.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to think algorithmically.
* Good communication and collaboration skills.

**Preferred Skills:**

* Experience with NoSQL databases (e.g., MongoDB, Cassandra) is a plus.
* Knowledge of software development methodologies and practices.
* Experience with cloud-based database services (AWS RDS, Azure SQL Database, Google Cloud SQL).
* Experience working with Healthcare or HCIT companies.

**Benefits**

* Competitive salary
* Great benefits package including medical, dental, vision, HSA & FSA plans
* 401(k)
* Generous PTO plan, plus 12 paid national holidays
* Fun, collaborative environment where the company is working to define the future of telemedicine
* Excellent opportunity for professional growth

title: Mid-Senior level MS SQL Database Administrator (Remote)
description:
At FEI Systems, we create innovative technology solutions to improve the delivery of health and human services because we know when cumbersome administrative processes stand in the way, those who need it most are often left without access to proper care and support. From comprehensive case management software to disaster recovery services and content management information systems used in delivering foreign aid, our solutions are improving the lives of millions of people. We’re looking for a database administrator who shares our commitment to leveraging technology to make a real impact in the world – a professional who knows, beyond all else, that the quality of our products and services is only as good as the company we keep.

**Job Summary**
We are looking for a Mid to Senior level MS SQL Database Administrator that will report to the Technical Operation Director. You will be responsible for management and support of the database server for both on-prem and on cloud environment. The DBA will primarily focus on the production environment but will also oversee the development environment. The DBA will lead the assessment and implementation of new technologies and administration of database installations, designing and scheduling of database backups, and be responsible for disaster recovery solutions. The DBA will work with a team of DBA's and Database Developers to support mission critical health care applications.  

  

**Primary** **Responsibilities** **will include (but not be limited to):*** 24x7 mission critical production environment support to achieve business goals and objectives
* Collaborate with the development teams to develop and define database architecture of our systems
* Ensure that all phases of technical documentation is completed and maintained
* Enforce database standards and guidelines
* Perform ongoing database administration along with performance tuning for both on-prem and cloud environments.
* Design and build HA and DR solutions for MS SQL databases for on-prem and cloud platforms.
* Support the data warehouse database in addition to OLTP systems
* Create SQL scripts for data conversion, reports, data analysis and data patch

 **Required Experience / Qualifications:*** BE or BS Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related field preferred
* 3+ years of DBA experience required, preferably 5+ years
* Experience working with MS SQL on Windows platform
* Experience on managing PostgreSQL Server with Linux/Unix platform is a plus.
* 1-2 years minimum experience in managing AWS cloud database platforms.
* 3-5 years minimum experience in database operations support with strong understanding of database structures, theories, principles, and practices.
* Experience with the installation, development, maintenance and enhancement of MS SQL and PostgreSQL RDBMS to support Agile development teams and mission critical production systems.
* Create SQL scripts for data conversion, reports, data analysis and data patch.
* Shell scripting and job automation experience
* Clear communication with interpersonal, written, and verbal skills
* Self-motivated and directed, with keen attention to detail
* Able to prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment
* Experience with SQL scripting (creating and implementing)
* Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
* Knowledge of NoSQL database and .net/c# application is a plus.

 **Preferred Skills:*** MS SQL server, ETL and OLAP technology knowledge and practice
* Knowledge and experience on AWS services, such as RDS, Aurora, EC2, etc.
* Database tasks implementation experience in an Agile development environment
* Experience with Data Conversion Strategy
* Be able to understand, parse, and develop Json dataset
* NoSQL database technology and practice
* Database modelling experience
* Leadership skills with team-oriented style
* Ability to communicate effectively, work well with the team, and exercise sound judgement.

 **Location:** Remote**Status**: Full time position with full company benefits

title: JC-416175 - Telework Option - Hybrid - Database Administrator
company: California Department of Housing and Community Development
description:
**Job Duties**

**Under California Government Code Section 14200, this position is eligible for hybrid telework and may be eligible for full-time remote work in some circumstances and/or time-periods, at the sole discretion of the Department. Telework-eligible applicants must reside in California. Headquarter location will be designated on the selected candidate's primary residence location. This is subject to change if HCD's criteria is met.**

Under the general direction of the IT Supervisor II, the Information Technology Associate (ITA) provides services that encompass the IT domain of System Engineering. The incumbent provides guidance to the application support teams for Network and implementation of information systems to meet organizational requirements as well as troubleshoot production application issues and perform root cause analysis. The incumbent works with other subject matter experts (SMEs), such as information security specialists, network, and server administrators as required to support Housing and Community Development (HCD) applications. This position is expected to develop proficiency in database administration during the probationary period. We will provide on-the-job training and you will be mentored by your peers.

**Desirables**

* Experience with database design and be able to create and maintain databases that are efficient and effective.
* Experience working with database management systems such as Microsoft SQL Server
* Experience with SQL or T-SQL commands
* Experience using programming languages such as Java, Python, and scripting languages.
* Ability to communicate effectively (verbally/written)
* Excellent computer skills
* Possess good interpersonal skills
* Ability to work independently, as well as in a team environment
* Ability to organize and prioritize multiple assignments
* Ability to promote a positive working environment and relationship with others

**Essential Functions**

Ensure that SQLdatabases run at optimal performance and provide reliable access to HCD data. Perform all activities related to administration of the HCD application databases including but not limited to design, installation, configuration, security, upgrades & migrations, backup & recovery, performance & monitoring, capacity planning, and patching of databases. Work collaboratively with the Department of Technology (CDT) staff to install, configure, implement, and maintain databases in all environments and ensure the data integration needs of the requirements are met. Provide updates and documentation to capture modifications to ensure databases, including installation and configuration procedures. Work with IT vendors to resolve the business-critical problems.

Maintain standards and procedures related to database design, database change control process, database integrity and security, database backup recovery, and maintenance activities. Create documentation of data analysis and specifications using best practices/methodologies including but not limited to business and system requirements, deliverables, physical and logical designs, entity relationship diagrams, detailed database designs and dictionary, DB scripts, system test specifications and results, work plans, and schedules. Document, escalate, and coordinate service interruption issues with external technical support vendors, make recommendations, and apply recommended solutions.

Research database components and implementation for future applications and architecture. Review project deliverables to assist in the analysis, design, development, and implementation of solutions. Review the work of others (including peers, team members, and/or subordinates) to ensure quality.

Attend regularly scheduled section and branch meetings, as well as training classes. Review technical journals or websites to acquire and maintain knowledge of applicable, emerging procedures and new industry best practices. Other duties as assigned.

Pay: $4,651.00 - $8,238.00 per month

* Dental insurance

* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

title: Sr. DataBase Engineer-Administrator - Remote
description:
**Remote**

**FIM (Foundational Infrastructure Modernization) Database Engineer/Administrator**   
**SCOPE OF SERVICES**  
A successful candidate will serve as a **Database Engineer/Administrator** reporting to the Infrastructure Management division. This position is responsible for delivering and overseeing the Agency’s multi-tenant databases and service offering as part of Foundational Infrastructure Modernization Project. The database Engineer will be responsible for leading projects and initiatives and making significant contribution to the technical design and implementation of the Agency’s database platforms under OTI’s directions. This role offers the opportunity to work across teams and contribute to the database services while leading the charge for database solution across service delivery; and involves critical thinking and problem solving in concert with the utilization of industry standard best practices.

**TASKS:**

* Install, configure, customize, create, implement, and support Oracle databases in Non-RAC and RAC environments, and software and related tools/products for the database systems.
* Implement Grid Infrastructure release 19c on a OS Unix/Linux platform support databases;
* Implement Oracle Automatic Storage Management (ASM) cluster Filesystem and maintain it; Add new disks to an ASM disk group.
* Patching grid infrastructure and Oracle RDBMS.
* Setup Oracle database security environment.
* Carry out DB Performance Tuning, and RMAN backups.
* Working with Oracle, implement best of class solutions.
* Utilize Linux Administration skills as needed; develop UNIX shell scripts; Automation using ansible; work with the Database team and teams of Unix engineers and administrators to design, build, upgrade and support the necessary Oracle infrastructure to meet the needs of OTI and OTI hosted supported agencies.
* Work hands on more extensive projects such as migration, implementing of new features, architectures and validation and assisting OTI.
* Configure Golden gate replication; both integrated and microservices based configuration.
* Configure Oracle RAC and ASM technologies on Redhat Linux.
* Configure Oracle Data Guard with Active and Standby database modes.
* Assist developers and end users in implementing best practices and addressing performance issues in implementation.
* Ensure all databases are backed up and meets the business’s Recovery Point Objectives (RPO) and Recovery Time Objectives (RTO)
* Lead team efforts in adopting in modernized architecture such as hybrid cloud and database ready for hybrid cloud.
* Perform RCA; manage different database encryption technologies; and implement DR by design and validate.
* Perform special projects, and initiatives as assigned by OTI.
* Experience with latest Oracle versions and their features but not limited to Multi-tenant Architecture, Oracle Partitioning, Real Application Testing (RAT), Oracle Database Vault.

**MANDATORY SKILLS/EXPERIENCE**

* Minimum 12 years of hands- o n experience in database engineering.
* Ability to work independently.
* Experience in implementing/managing Oracle Databases in a RAC environment with at least 2 years of production support.
* Experience in Implementing Grid Infrastructure release 19 or higher on a Redhat Linux environment.
* Experience implementing ASM cluster Filesystem with knowledge of how to maintain it for successful operational delivery.
* Knowledge of Best Practices for adding a new disk to an ASM disk group.
* Experience patching grid infrastructure software.
* Familiarity with Oracle database resource manager.
* Familiar with Ansible/automation/scripting.
* Familiarity with huge pages on Linux.
* Experience supporting a high-availability production database.
* Experience in configuring/supporting Oracle Active Data Guard required.
* Experience in database architecture and design; Oracle Advanced Security Option; and Golden
* Gate for Oracle Replication
* Knowledge of working on cloud environments preferable AWS & AZURE.
* Participate in application/DB outage incidents during trouble shooting and provides solution and RCA.

**DESIRABLE SKILLS/EXPERIENCE:** 

Experience with Oracle Advanced Security Option is highly desirable.

title: Oracle Database Administrator
Database Administrator
description:
BreakForth Solutions is seeking a Database administrator to join our team of dynamic professionals. We offer 100% paid medical for the employee, 401k, as well as a host of other amazing benefits. Please apply today!

**Position Information**:


BreakForth Solutions is seeking a Database Administrator (DBA) to support our federal customers. The successful candidate will be part of a team, collaborating closely with our customers to ensure successful oversight and client delivery of impacted projects. The Database Administrator is a technical expert on all aspects of database administration and maintenance for Oracle and MS SQL servers. In this position, the Database Administrator will manage and deliver functionality in close collaboration with clients, ensuring successful oversight and client delivery of impacted projects.

**Essential Functions**:


The DBA is a technical expert on all aspects of database administration and maintenance for Oracle and MS SQL servers. This role will be responsible for performing tasks such as the following:

* Evaluate and develop database hosting requirements.
* Plan database deployments and execute the plan.
* Develop database designs.
* Administer system and user accounts.
* Install, patch, and maintain database software.
* Create databases.
* Ensure backup procedures are in place and are working properly.
* Backup and restore databases.
* Tune database performance.
* Support data migration activities.
* Perform planned and unplanned updates to database environments.
* Perform scheduled and unscheduled maintenance.
* Download and install patches.
* Monitor and troubleshoot database performance issues.
* Mitigate database vulnerabilities identified in database scans.
* Implement and support Oracle, SQL, open source, and cloud-based databases.
* Support ISO 20000 and ITIL processes and SLA requirements.
* Supports Change Control Board (CCB) procedures.
* Supports continuous deployment with DevOps tools, planning, and agile processes and thinking.
* Apply best practices, tools, and methods to support the delivery of projects on time, within budget, and to performance specifications

 **Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related fields
* 8+ years of hands-on experience installing, configuring, managing, and migrating databases in SQL Server managed instances.
* Experience developing and administering architectures that implement high-availability solutions.
* Understanding best practices and knowledge of tools and programming languages used to upgrade, migrate, manage, and administer services within a SQL server infrastructure.
* Experience troubleshooting Oracle and SQL Server databases to minimize adverse performance issues.
* Experience installing, configuring, developing, deploying, and managing reports using SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS)
* Use of tools and applications to tune and assure optimal performance of systems (e.g., RMAN, ADDM, AWR, SQL Profiler, Performance Monitor)
* Experience with RMAN and IBM Tivoli Storage Manager (TSM) is preferred.
* Development of documentation for server environments, structure, and operating procedures

 **Education/Skills/Experience Requirements**:

* Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college/university.
* Must be detail-oriented.
* Excellent written and oral communication skills.
* Must be able to effectively and professionally interact with internal and external clients.
* Ability to work with no supervision.
* Must have proven experience meeting tight deadlines.
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Excellent time management skills
* Must be hands-on and take proactive ownership of projects

 ***BreakForth Solutions Incorporated is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment. We do not discriminate against any team member or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex (including pregnancy), religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, national origin, marital status, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.***

title: Donor Database Specialist
description:
**Donor Database Specialist**
**Who We Are + What We Do**
The Land Institute co-leads the global movement for perennial, diverse, regenerative grain agriculture at a scale that matches the enormity of the intertwined climate, water, and food security crises. An independent 501c3 non-profit founded in 1976, the organization seeks to reconcile the human economy with nature's economy, starting with food. The transdisciplinary team of scientists, together with global partners, are developing new perennial grain crops, like Kernza©, and diverse cropping systems that function within nature's limits while researching the social transformation required for a just, perennial human future.


**How You’d Fit In + Stand Out**
The Donor Database Specialist plays a critical role in our fundraising team by ensuring the accuracy, integrity, and accessibility of our donor data—the foundation of our growth trajectory as an organization in a scaling phase. This position manages and operationalizes our donor database, analyzes donor information, and curates actionable insights to inform a successful fundraising strategy. This person will collaborate within the fundraising team to maximize donor engagement, support our collective mission with agility, and offer insight into emerging patterns and trends from donor profiles. The Donor Database Specialist position is responsible for concrete functionality such as gift entry, yet it is also dynamic and open to growth, creativity, and input into strategy-alignment ideas. This role is internally facing and has a tremendous impact on the organization and The Land Institute's work to co-lead the global movement for perennial, diverse, truly regenerative agriculture at scale.  

**Primary Responsibilities + Expectations**
**Database Management:**
* Maintain and update the donor database daily to ensure accurate and up-to-date donor records.
* Import and export donor data as needed while ensuring data security and privacy compliance.
* Develop and implement data entry and quality control procedures.
* Act as the liaison in our Blackbaud (Raiser’s Edge) vendor relationship, providing expertise in technical problem solving, contract suggestions, etc.

**Data Analysis:**
* Analyze donor data to identify trends, donor behavior, and opportunities for fundraising growth.
* Prepare reports and dashboards to track fundraising progress and provide insights to the fundraising team.
* Segment donor lists for targeted fundraising campaigns and initiatives.
* Prepare annual reports required for annual audit and 990 filings.

**Gift Processing:**
* Manage the daily processing of donations, ensuring timely and accurate acknowledgment of contributions.
* Reconcile financial records with the database to maintain data accuracy.

**Collaboration:**
* Work closely as part of the fundraising team to align data analysis with fundraising strategies.
* Collaborate with cross-organization colleagues to support donor engagement and retention efforts.
* Ensure accurate and timely reports to our accounting department to ensure successful audits.


**Organizational Competencies:**


* **Mission Driven**: You are passionate about the mission of The Land Institute and are interested in aligning your skills and personal genius to benefit the mission.
* **Courageous**: You do not retreat or shy away from hard things. You face challenges and conflict with professionalism, grace, and resolve.
* **A Boundary Spanner**: You bring an interdisciplinary skill set and model self-awareness in your preferences. You are always motivated to learn, and you adapt to span boundaries with people across a range of perspectives.
* **Inspiring and Inspired:** You are inspired by the people around you—finding and harnessing the genius in your colleagues to meet the organizational objectives—and you inspire others through example and your applied genius.
* **Growth Mindset:** You have the vulnerability to know what you don’t know, identify and learn from mistakes, and learn from others to grow and develop yourself and the organization.
* **A Creative Collaborato**r: You believe in the power of a diverse collective to generate ideas and solutions. You excel at strategic thinking, being open to new perspectives, and managing innovation. You bring a playful, positive approach to the work and enjoy meeting new people and deepening connections with those you already know.
* **Excited by Change**: You embrace nascent and evolving situations and enjoy engaging new people, ideas, and possibilities. You think about change holistically: internal, external, organizational, and cultural. You like iterating systems, building efficiency, and operationalizing design. You are willing to jump in and contribute to new projects as needed.


**Qualifications:**
* Bachelor's degree, or equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.
* Proficiency in donor database management software (e.g., Blackbaud’s Raiser’s Edge), with a strong understanding of data structure and optimal operations.
* Demonstrated ability to utilize software and web-based applications (e.g., Microsoft, Google),
* Experience in data analysis and reporting, including data visualization tools.
* Strong attention to detail and accuracy in data management.
* Knowledge of data privacy regulations and best practices.
* Advanced proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, Tableau).
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

 **Preferred Qualifications:**
* Experience working in a nonprofit or fundraising environment.
* Familiarity with fundraising software and CRM systems.
* Knowledge of fundraising trends and best practices.
* Demonstrated agility in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

 **Location + Travel:**
* Open
* Travel will not be required in this position


**Compensation + Benefits:**
The Land Institute offers an excellent benefits package and a competitive salary commensurate with experience.  


The salary range for this position is $45,000 to $55,000.  


* Paid parental leave
* Competitive, equitable compensation
* 403(b) Retirement
* 403(b) Employer contributions
* Health Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* Employer-Provided Life Insurance
* Flexible Spending Account
* Dependent Care
* Short-term and Long-term Disability Insurance
* Voluntary Life Insurance
* Accidental Insurance
* Critical Illness Insurance
* Employee Assistance Program
* Paid holidays
* Generous PTO


*The Land Institute is an equal opportunity employer and embraces the opportunity to provide employment to qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age (40 or older), disability, or genetic information. We are pleased to provide reasonable accommodations to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.*

title: Oracle Database Administrator
description:
Synergy Business Innovation & Solutions is a premier implementer of cutting-edge software solutions. Synergy brings the experience and expertise necessary to deliver capability that provides tangible ROI to our customers. Synergy’s core areas of expertise are in the fields of Digital Transformation, Cloud Solutions, SaaS and Low-Code/No-Code solutions, Emerging Technologies, Data analytics and Visualization, Information Assurance, and Business Process Re-Engineering.

Synergy offers its employees a generous portfolio of core and voluntary benefits including group medical, dental, and vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k) with immediately vested company match, PTO, sick leave, 11 paid federal holidays, company paid life, short-term and long-term disability insurance, tuition and training reimbursement, fitness/wellness reimbursement, a referral bonus program, and life management programs.

At Synergy, you’ll be challenged and given the opportunity to grow in your career path. In fact, growth is such a big deal to us that you will have dedicated career coaches available for every employee, company-funded certification opportunities, education reimbursement, and a general open-door policy so that you have support when you need it. Our team is eager to learn, fast-paced, and quality-driven—if that sounds like you, Synergy has a position for you!

This position is designated as work-from-home.

**Description**

· Provides competent leadership, and highly specialized and technical guidance to complex Database Administration challenges.

· Has detailed specialized experience in recent or rare technologies. Simultaneously plans, manages, and provides technical oversight for other database administrators.

· Works in cross functional domain of data analyst and database administrator. Able to work in ambiguous circumstances.

· Supports users by resolving problems with application databases. Provides direction to junior Database Administrators.

· Has substantive experience in Database Administration discipline(s) and technologies described in an actual task order proposal.

· Coordinates with Program Manager and Assistant Program manager to ensure problem resolution and customer satisfaction.

· Provide expert support for production application databases with respect to availability, reliability, and integrity.

· Work with application developers and their logical data models, create physical application database designs which conform to industry standards (e.g., data normalization), optimize performance and efficiently utilize disk space, size tables and indexes for production implementation based on projected row counts provided by applications.

· Create complex new databases and application database objects (e.g., tables, indexes, procedures), and as requirements change, update data structures/objects in existing databases.

· Coordinate production database deployment including tasks to promote database objects between environments (e.g., test to production) in support of application requirements.

· Provide technical leadership to Application developers in database capabilities and features, build efficient queries, database design, application database Problem resolution, and the use of database utilities.

· Determine and implement appropriate application database backup and recovery strategies, including decisions regarding frequency of backup and procedures for recovering application database Changes.

· Perform production database recovery when necessary.

**Skills, Qualifications and Certifications of Best Candidates:**

· Advanced knowledge of networking concepts, object-oriented technology, data warehousing, and relational database engines (e.g., Oracle, SQL Server).

· Advanced proficiency in analytical, project planning, negotiating, interpersonal, and communication skills (written and oral).

· Experienced Oracle DBA with thorough knowledge of Oracle 12c, 19c, 21c

· Experienced working with shell and PL/SQL scripts to execute application workloads of stored procs, batch activities, and maintenance

· Expertise in data and application architecture principles

· Familiar with Git source control

· Experience with database versioning tools like Flyway / Liquidbase

· Ability to learn quickly and work independently or as part of a team

· Ability to take ownership of assigned role and serve as the SME

· Ability to obtain Public Trust Clearance

· Must be a U.S. citizen or foreign citizen authorized to legally work in the United States

· Must be clearable to a Secret Clearance

**Preferred Education & Experience:** 5-7 years of experience as a relational database administrator, and a Bachelor of Arts/Science Degree in Computer Science or related field or an equivalent combination of education and/or experience.

**Citizenship or Work Authorization Required:** US Citizen

**Essential Job Function Physical Requirements:** The physical requirements of this position are critical in evaluating the qualifications and abilities of an applicant or employee. The physical efforts needed to perform the essential duties of this job 90% of the time are repetitive motions, grasping, holding, and finger dexterity of the hands, reading, writing, eye-hand coordination, color distinction, and full visual abilities, hearing, talking, sitting, and use of IT equipment, phones, and office machines.

To a reduced degree, <30% of the time, candidates may have to stand, walk, lift 0-30 pounds, push or pull objects, climb stairs, bend, squat, reach, drive a car, or work overtime.

Synergy prefers that all new employees be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 before their start date.

***Synergy is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate against applicants for employment or its employees on the basis of age, race, creed, color, religion, ancestry, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, military status, sex, medical condition, pregnancy, physical or mental disability, personal appearance, predisposing genetic characteristics, family responsibilities, familial status, marital status, status as a victim of domestic violence, political affiliation, arrest records and criminal convictions, or any other characteristic protected by law. Discrimination or harassment based upon these protected categories is expressly prohibited.***

title: Senior Database Administrator
description:
Cloudbeds provides the platform that powers hospitality, driving streamlined operations, increasing reservations and revenue, and enabling memorable guest experiences for lodging businesses of all sizes and types. Named the No. 1 PMS and No. 1 Hotel Management System by Hotel Tech Report in 2022, Cloudbeds is trusted by properties across the globe for its award-winning front desk, revenue, distribution, guest acquisition and guest engagement solutions seamlessly combined in a single unified system.



Behind the Cloudbeds platform is a growing team of 700+ employees distributed across 40+ countries speaking 30+ languages. From data architects to UX designers, integrations managers to payments experts, former hotel managers to former OTA executives, our team comprises the brightest minds in technology and hospitality working to solve the industry's biggest challenges.



From the beginning, we've believed that our people are our greatest asset, so we founded the company as #RemoteFirst, #RemoteAlways with shared core values that allow our team to thrive. This means we:


* Hire the best people around the world;
* Emphasize the value of results over hours put in;
* Provide flexibility in working hours and locations;
* Foster an inclusive environment that celebrates bold thinking and diverse perspectives;
* Offer open vacation policies, free LinkedIn Learning, and other benefits that promote well-being and professional development.

As a**Senior Database Administrator** (DBA) / Aurora Specialist, you will be responsible for managing and maintaining database systems, particularly those utilizing Amazon Aurora. You will play a crucial role in ensuring the availability, performance, and security of the database infrastructure. This position requires a deep understanding of database management, optimization, and the ability to troubleshoot and resolve complex database issues.


**Location**: NORAM


**What You Will Do**:


* Database Administration
+ Create and manage database instances, clusters, and replicas.
+ Perform routine database maintenance tasks, such as backups, restores, and updates.
+ Monitor database performance and proactively identify and resolve bottlenecks and issues.
+ Optimize database queries and indexing for improved performance.

* Security and Compliance
+ Implement and enforce security policies and access controls to safeguard sensitive data.
+ Ensure compliance with industry regulations and best practices (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA).

* Backup and Recovery:
+ Develop and maintain database backup and recovery strategies.
+ Test and document disaster recovery procedures to ensure data availability in case of failures.

* High Availability and Scaling
+ Configure and manage database replication, failover, and clustering for high availability.
+ Scale database resources to accommodate growing workloads.

* Performance Tuning
+ Identify and resolve performance issues by analyzing query execution plans and database statistics.
+ Optimize database schema and configurations for improved efficiency.

* Documentation and Training:
+ Maintain comprehensive documentation of database configurations, procedures, and best practices.
+ Provide training and guidance to other team members on database-related tasks and technologies.

* Troubleshooting and Issue Resolution:
+ Investigate and resolve database-related incidents and outages in a timely manner.
+ Collaborate with development and infrastructure teams to troubleshoot application-related database problems.

* Stay Current with Technology:
+ Keep up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in database technologies, especially Amazon Aurora.

**You'll Succeed With**:


* Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
* Proven experience as a Database Administrator, with a focus on Amazon MySQL Aurora with 5+ years of experience.
* Proficiency in SQL and database query optimization.
* Strong understanding of database security, backup, and recovery procedures.
* Familiarity with cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
* Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.


**Nice to Haves****:**


* Certifications in database technologies and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS Certified Database - Specialty) is a plus.


Depending on your skills and experience, you can expect your annual compensation to be between $120,000 to $150,000



#LI-IK1


Our company culture supports flexible working schedules with an open Paid Time Away policy and gives all team members the opportunity to travel and work remotely with great people. If you think you have the skills and passion, we'll give you the support and opportunity to thrive in your career. If you would like to be considered for the role, we would love to hear from you!

title: SQL Database Administrator
description:
Introduction  

At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.  

  

Your Role and Responsibilities  

Must work Thursday- Monday day shift schedule
Octo, an IBM company, is an industry-leading, award-winning provider of technical solutions for the federal government. At Octo, we specialize in providing agile software engineering, user experience design, cloud services, and digital strategy services that address government's most pressing missions. Octo delivers intelligent solutions and rapid results, yielding lower costs and measurable outcomes.


Our team is what makes Octo great. At Octo you'll work beside some of the smartest and most accomplished staff you'll find in your career. Octo offers fantastic benefits and an amazing workplace culture where you will feel valued while you perform mission critical work for our government. Voted one of the region’s best places to work multiple times, Octo is an employer of choice!


As a Microsoft SQL Database Administrator (DBA) at Octo, you will support the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA).
Must be able to work days Thursday- Monday day shift schedule.


The DBAs will help create, implement, and manage database administration processes and procedures in a large medical data warehouse environment. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in database security, T-SQL, and PowerShell with the ability to adopt and incrementally improve existing practices and conventions. The DBAs will work in a team environment with other DBA team members, support cross-training for the DBA team, and work with other teams including the ETL and Architecture Teams. The DBAs must be able to provide management of database-related Windows platform components at the server hardware and software level and have extensive experience with current versions of Microsoft SQL Server (2016/2019), on site and in Microsoft Azure. The DBAs will provide support in these database environments, including testing and installation of upgrades and migrations, and contributing documentation to the existing DBA Team handbook.


Us...


We were founded as a fresh alternative in the Government Consulting Community and are dedicated to the belief that results are a product of analytical thinking, agile design principles and that solutions are built in collaboration with, not for, our customers. This mantra drives us to succeed and act as true partners in advancing our client’s missions.


Years of Experience: Position requires at least 5 years database administration experience with Microsoft SQL Server (2016/2019)


Education: Bachelor’s degree, or a minimum of 8 years’ equivalent work experience, required.


Location: Fully remote.


Clearance: Ability to obtain and maintain government clearance.  



  

  

Required Technical and Professional Expertise  

* Installation, administration, and maintenance of SQL Server instances.
* Management, maintenance, and setup of test, development, staging and production data warehouse environments.
* Backup / Recovery and Integrity Checks.
* Monitoring and continuous improvement of high availability implementations.
* Regular database capacity planning for the data warehouse environment.
* Documentation of the existing system and improvements as they are planned and implemented.
* Testing, implementing and appropriately documenting all changes.
* Troubleshooting various problems that arise from day-to-day activities and fix the issues.
* Monitoring SQL Server error logs and checking e-mail alerts.
* Documenting database configurations.
* Strong foundation in the creation and maintenance of SQL Server database objects such as tables, indexes, views, stored procedures, and functions.
* Experience with SQL Server security at the server and database level.
* Experience with native Backup and recovery techniques.
* Experience with Windows and SQL Server Fail-over Clusters.
* Extensive experience with Transact-SQL (T-SQL).
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, as well as solid interpersonal skills.
* Strong aptitude to learn and adapt to technology.
* Effective project management, time management, and organizational skills.
* Ability to adapt well to a DBA Team environment and work with other teams.
* Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with all levels in an organization.
* Strong team interaction skills.
* Detail oriented with strong analytical and organizational skills.
* Must be able to obtain and maintain public trust clearance.
* Must be eligible to work in the United States.
* Clearance: Ability to obtain and maintain government clearance.
* Must work Thursday- Monday day shift schedule

  

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise  

* Experience supporting database and server functions for federal organizations; experience at the VA is preferred.

  

About Business UnitIBM Consulting is IBM’s consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. With deep expertise in many industries, we offer strategy, experience, technology, and operations services to many of the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients’ businesses through the power of collaboration. We believe in the power of technology responsibly used to help people, partners and the planet.  

  

Your Life @ IBMIn a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships, lives in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better.
Being an IBMer means you’ll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you’ll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background.


Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do.


Are you ready to be an IBMer?

  

About IBMIBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.  

  

Location StatementIBM offers a competitive and comprehensive benefits program. Eligible employees may have access to: - Healthcare benefits including medical & prescription drug coverage, dental, vision, and mental health & well being - Financial programs such as 401(k), the IBM Employee Stock Purchase Plan, financial counseling, life insurance, short & long- term disability coverage, and opportunities for performance based salary incentive programs - Generous paid time off including 12 holidays, minimum 56 hours sick time, 120 hours vacation, 12 weeks parental bonding leave in accordance with IBM Policy, and other Paid Care Leave programs. IBM also offers paid family leave benefits to eligible employees where required by applicable law - Training and educational resources on our personalized, AI-driven learning platform where IBMers can grow skills and obtain industry-recognized certifications to achieve their career goals - Diverse and inclusive employee resource groups, giving & volunteer opportunities, and discounts on retail products, services & experiences The compensation range and benefits for this position are based on a full-time schedule for a full calendar year. The salary will vary depending on your job-related skills, experience and location. Pay increment and frequency of pay will be in accordance with employment classification and applicable laws. For part time roles, your compensation and benefits will be adjusted to reflect your hours. Benefits may be pro-rated for those who start working during the calendar year. This position was posted on the date cited in the key job details section and is anticipated to remain posted for 21 days from this date or less if not needed to fill the role. We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. IBM will not be providing visa sponsorship for this position now or in the future. Therefore, in order to be considered for this position, you must have the ability to work without a need for current or future visa sponsorship.  

  

Being You @ IBMIBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, caste, genetics, pregnancy, disability, neurodivergence, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

title: Database Administrator
description:
**About Our Company**  

It’s not just a job. It’s a mission. If you’re as passionate as we are about empowering the small businesses of America, then you’ll be right at home with us.  

**Rapid Finance** is the nation's leading provider of alternative financing solutions for small and mid-sized businesses. When traditional sources of funding are beyond reach, we open doors for small business owners, providing access to the working capital that they need. With **Rapid Finance**, growing businesses can achieve their goals and reach even higher.  

Our company is expanding into the future. We are aggressively investing in our people and technology as we aim to create a best-in-class experience for our clients. **Let us invest in YOU**!  

**About the Opportunity**  

The **Database Administrator** is responsible for the architecture, security, maintenance and optimization of databases at Rapid Finance.  

The applicant will work with Software Development, Business Intelligence and IT staff to set up and maintain various Microsoft SQL Server databases which support transactional applications and data warehouses location onprem and in cloud environments.  

To succeed in this critical role, these individuals will act as point on several development efforts, have well developed communication skills at both technical and functional levels, offer solutions to problems and take pride in the highest quality of work possible. Applicant should have very strong technical skills and be able to work as part of a dynamic team in a fast paced environment.  

**Responsibilities will include:*** Implementing and Supporting best practice DB architecture designs
* Implementing and Supporting various SQL failover scenarios
* Implementing and Supporting data replication across multiple environments
* Maintaining and upgrading the HADR infrastructure (AlwaysOn) for performance and redundancy
* Monitoring and optimizing processing power and disk utilization
* Managing logging and backup strategies
* Supporting Power BI, SSRS and SSIS activities and development
* Upgrading software versions as needed

**Required qualifications:*** Strong experience in a Microsoft SQL Server database administration role
* Strong experience with Azure related SQL Technologies (Azure SQL, SQL MI, SQL on VM, etc).
* Strong experience with clustered, replicated and load balanced systems
* Strong experience with deploying and maintaining SQL failover based systems
* Thorough and detail oriented – comfortable testing own code and documenting designs
* Problem solver – Someone who makes recommendations by identifying the problem, collaborating with stakeholders and business process owners to solve complicated issues with sustainable processes and systems, and follows up to test the implemented solution
* Well-rounded – Strong analysis, communications, interpersonal skills and project management skills are essential
* Great communication skills needed to bridge gap between various stakeholders - internal and external, technical and non-technical
* Interest in staying current by learning new technologies
* Most importantly, great problem-solving skills

**Sound like you? You’ll be a serious contender if:*** You have a clear understanding and hands-on experience in installing and configuring a variety of SQL related technologies, including MS SQL Server, Azure SQL, Power BI, SSRS and SSIS.
* You have knowledge of automated uptime and performance monitoring
* You have an understanding of optimizing database designs for performance and to ensure data integrity
* You have knowledge of database design best practices for both OLTP and OLAP systems
* You have a strong understanding about installing and configuring a HADR infrastructure using AlwaysOn
* You have knowledge of hardware and infrastructure best practices for MS SQL Server
* You don’t wait around for answers – you go and find them.
* You are adaptable. You can be flexible and enjoy working in a fun & exciting team environment. Expect a fast pace, energy and the occasional flying ping pong ball.
* You want to make an impact. We are a rapidly growing business, and you will have the opportunity to make a significant impact on our clients, our culture, and our future.
* You share our passion for the small businesses of America and have a desire to be part of something bigger than yourself.

**Why Rapid Finance?**  

**Rapid Finance** seeks the best and brightest. To us, finding and keeping A-talent is as important as closing a million-dollar deal. That’s just one of the reasons why we have been so successful, growing more than 20 percent every year.  

Our team benefits from a commuting or parking allowance, employer-matched 401(k), tuition reimbursement, paid time off, and more. Just steps from the metro, our beautiful new office includes a modern open floor plan, free on-site fitness center, a gaming area, stocked kitchen, and other cool amenities.  

**Rapid Finance is an equal opportunity employer and committed to a diverse workforce.**
