title: Application Support Engineer
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  

This position is for a Senior SAP Basis Administrator, for the Global SAP ECC 6.0 System which is used as the Domestic Ledger system and SAP BW 7.x on NetWeaver platform is used for reporting. The SAP Senior Basis Administrator is responsible for the management of the SAP environment and integration with external application components. He / she responsible to configure, monitor, recommend and tune the SAP Application components to ensure every integration layers (ABAP, DB, Network, Storage & Backup Layer) are fully functional based on business requirements. The SAP Basis Administrator is responsible for the installation, upgrade, and maintenance of SAP systems. Additional areas include the evaluation and design of interfaces, between SAP and external systems, maintenance of the SAP Data Dictionary and database objects, and manage the migration of SAP database and application configuration from development to production systems.

**JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of trillion and operations in more than 60 countries. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers, small business and commercial banking, financial transaction processing, asset management, and private equity.**  



**Responsibilities and duties:**

* Daily administration, monitoring, troubleshooting, and tuning of SAP ECC 6.0, S/4 HANA, B4 HANA on HANA 2.0 platform with GRC or SOLUTION MANAGER integration
* Perform SAP software installation, upgrades, applying support packages, system copies/refreshes and installation add-on software components.
* Responding to and resolving infrastructure related incidents & problems
* Works with OS & DB Administrators for optimal SAP Performance
* Provide Support and Guidance to the other Project and Development teams during the build and QA cycle testing
* Provides local and remote site resiliency recovery processes across multiple SAP products to meet cyber resiliency requirements
* Provide all technical support to monitor proactively during critical processing period
* Perform system analysis across multiple layers and provide recommended approaches to improve system performance.
* Participate in multi-landscape design solutions, architecture recommendations, and strategies for continuous improvement.
* Maintain multi-landscape environments through remote copies, system refreshes, and transport management monitoring.
* Provide daily business process support for all the integrations from and to the SAP ECC, S/4 HANA. B4HANA and GRC applications and ensure all components are fully functional at all times
* Perform Daily System Health Checks on all SAP systems and do general troubleshooting and diagnostics checks on technical aspects of the system.
* Configure and Maintain Transport System Landscapes and operate Change Management Tools
* Provide Production Support 24x7 support with on-call responsibilities
* Work with SAP via OSS & Solution Manager to technical resolve problems

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science or related business field: or equivalent experience.
* Working understanding of complex software and information technology solutions.
* 12-15+ years working with SAP administration with demonstrated experience related to support, maintenance, and implementation projects.
* 8+ years’ experience with UNIX or LINUX platform preferably AIX 7.X or RHEL 8.X / 9.X operating systems
* 4 -5+ years of HANA 2.0 experience to support multi landscape system
* Able to work independently as well as coordinate with business and technical teams
* Good working knowledge using bash shell Scripting or python scripting will be value added but not essential
* Certified in any of the cloud platforms (AWS / AZURE / GCP / internal cloud solutions with third parties)
* Ability to mentor and provide technical guidance to internal and external teams




**Desired technologies:**

S/4 HANA FP01/FP02 and B4 HANA with NetWeaver integration components (Web dispatcher, LDAP-plugins, SNC, SSO and SPNEGO) on RHEL / SUSE LINUX platform, ECC 6.0 on AIX 7.3 with Oracle 19c database. Experience on the IBM Power Platform with any cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud and other vendor-based cloud solutions)


**ABOUT US**  

JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world’s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.  

  

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.

  

  

  

**ABOUT THE TEAM**  

  

Our Corporate Technology team relies on smart, driven people like you to develop applications and provide tech support for all our corporate functions across our network. Your efforts will touch lives all over the financial spectrum and across all our divisions: Global Finance, Corporate Treasury, Risk Management, Human Resources, Compliance, Legal, and within the Corporate Administrative Office. You’ll be part of a team specifically built to meet and exceed our evolving technology needs, as well as our technology controls agenda.

title: Software Engineer
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  

We have an exciting and rewarding opportunity for you to take your software engineering career to the next level.


As a Software Engineer III at JPMorgan Chase within the Infrastructure Platforms team, you serve as a seasoned member of an agile team to design and deliver trusted market-leading technology products in a secure, stable, and scalable way. You are responsible for carrying out critical technology solutions across multiple technical areas within various business functions in support of the firm’s business objectives.




**Job responsibilities**




* Executes software solutions, design, development, and technical troubleshooting with ability to think beyond routine or conventional approaches to build solutions or break down technical problems
* Creates secure and high-quality production code and maintains algorithms that run synchronously with appropriate systems
* Produces architecture and design artifacts for complex applications while being accountable for ensuring design constraints are met by software code development
* Gathers, analyzes, synthesizes, and develops visualizations and reporting from large, diverse data sets in service of continuous improvement of software applications and systems
* Proactively identifies hidden problems and patterns in data and uses these insights to drive improvements to coding hygiene and system architecture
* Contributes to software engineering communities of practice and events that explore new and emerging technologies
* Adds to team culture of diversity, equity, inclusion, and respect




**Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills**




* Formal training or certification on software engineering concepts and 3+ years applied experience
* Hands-on practical experience in system design, application development, testing, and operational stability
* Proficient in coding in one or more languages in JavaScript ,HTML, CSS, Glide APIs
* Experience in developing, debugging, and maintaining code in a large corporate environment with one or more modern programming languages and database querying languages
* Overall knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle
* Solid understanding of agile methodologies such as CI/CD, Applicant Resiliency, and Security
* Demonstrated knowledge of software applications and technical processes within a technical discipline (e.g., cloud, artificial intelligence, machine learning, mobile, etc.)
* Hands-on experience in implementation and customization of minimum two ServiceNow Modules
* Expertise in creating custom Business rules, Client-Scripts, Script Includes, ACL's, Email Notifications, Complex flows using both Workflows and Flow Designers
* Has experience working on System Integrations with ServiceNow and other Third Party tools using REST Methods
* Certified System Administrator and Certified Implementation Specialist in any ServiceNow Module




**Preferred qualifications, capabilities, and skills**




* Familiarity with modern front-end technologies
* Exposure to cloud technologies




**ABOUT US**  

JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world’s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.  

  

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.

  

  

  

**ABOUT THE TEAM**  

  

The Cybersecurity & Technology Controls group at JPMorgan Chase aligns the firm’s cybersecurity, access management, controls and resiliency teams. The group proactively and strategically partners with all lines of business and functions to enable them to design, adopt and integrate appropriate controls; deliver processes and solutions efficiently and consistently; and drive automation of controls. The group’s number one priority is to enable the business by keeping the firm safe, stable and resilient.  

  

High Risk Roles (HRR) are sensitive roles within the technology organization that require high assurance of the integrity of staff by virtue of 1) sensitive cybersecurity and technology functions they perform within systems or 2) information they receive regarding sensitive cybersecurity or technology matters. Users in these roles are subject to enhanced pre-hire screening which includes both criminal and credit background checks (as allowed by law). The enhanced screening will need to be successfully completed prior to commencing employment or assignment.

title: Database Administrator
description:
**Project Role :** Database Administrator  

**Project Role Description :** Administer, develop, test, or demonstrate databases. Perform many related database functions across one or more teams or clients, including designing, implementing and maintaining new databases, backup/recovery and configuration management. Install database management systems (DBMS) and provide input for modification of procedures and documentation used for problem resolution and day-to-day maintenance.
  

**Must have skills :** Red Hat OS Administration  

**Good to have skills :** NA  

Minimum **3** year(s) of experience is required  

**Educational Qualification :** BE  

  

Summary: As a Database Administrator, you will be responsible for administering, developing, testing, or demonstrating databases. Your typical day will involve designing, implementing, and maintaining new databases, performing backup/recovery, and configuration management. Roles & Responsibilities: - Install and configure database management systems (DBMS) and provide input for modification of procedures and documentation used for problem resolution and day-to-day maintenance. - Perform database maintenance activities such as backups, restores, and recovery. - Design, implement, and maintain new databases, including creating database schemas, tables, and indexes. - Collaborate with cross-functional teams to troubleshoot and resolve database-related issues. - Develop and maintain database documentation, including data standards, procedures, and definitions. Professional & Technical Skills: - Must To Have Skills: Strong experience in Red Hat OS Administration. - Good To Have Skills: Experience with other database management systems such as Oracle, MySQL, or SQL Server. - Experience in database backup and recovery procedures. - Experience in database performance tuning and optimization. - Experience in database security and access control. - Experience in database replication and clustering technologies. Additional Information: - The candidate should have a minimum of 3 years of experience in Red Hat OS Administration. - The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in computer science, information technology, or a related field, along with a proven track record of delivering impactful database solutions. - This position is based at our Pune office.


  

BE

title: Database Administrator
description:
ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES


As a member of the Data Operations Team, the mid-level Database Administrator will be responsible for the strategic oversight and leadership in managing the PostgreSQL and MySQL database environments. They are responsible for architectural planning, leading database-related projects, and providing guidance and mentorship to other staff. Applicants should have extensive experience with complex database management, possess advanced technical skills, and demonstrate strong leadership qualities. The role requires in-depth knowledge gained from prior roles, a proven track record of successful database administration, and the ability to work well with others.

 **ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**


? Work as the Database Administrator supporting the Data Operations Team


? Responsible for ensuring availability and performance of all databases that support our systems


? Experience building, configuration, and maintaining a clustered environment


? Work to ensure that associated hardware resources are allocated to the databases and to ensure high resilience and performance tuning to provide 7/24/365 availability


? Manage, plan, and implement a solid disaster recovery process


? Able to proactively monitor the database systems and ensure appropriate monitoring and notification


? Analyze databases to optimize and tune for optimal performance


? Able to Create/Edit SQL, triggers, stored procedures, functions


? Responsible for database security management


? Documentation as necessary for training, and internal/external audit requirements


? Ensure database backups, rotation, and retention are performed according to IT policy


? Plan, coordinate, and implement security measures to safeguard database information against accidental or unauthorized damage, modification, or disclosure, according to security policies


? Perform other job-related duties as assigned

 **REQUIRED SKILLS AND ABILITIES**


? Strong communication and organization skills


? Ability to multi-task and manage time is essential


? Ability to effectively engage and work with a variety of roles and teams


? Strong written and oral communication skills


? Well-developed written and verbal communication skills, specifically documentation skills


? Ability to use critical thinking in solving a problem

  

Nice to have:


? Prior experience in benefit program administration; knowledge of Health and Welfare processes a plus


? Solid understanding of other database query languages i.e. (SQL Server, Oracle, NoSQL, etc.)


? Scripting experience i.e. (PowerShell, Python, Perl, Bash, etc.)


? Experience within a major public cloud service provider such as the following:


o Microsoft Azure


o Amazon Web Services


o Google Cloud Platform

 **KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND/OR EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS**


Bachelor’s degree preferred but not required...


Should be able to work on US CST Shift timings


 In lieu of bachelor’s degree, equivalent years of experience in computer science, engineering, certifications, or a related field


 Overall, 7+ years' experience in related areas of work as a Database Administrator


5+ years of experience in the following areas:


o Database Design, Management, Capacity planning, & resource forecasting


o Performance Tuning (Server and code)


o T-SQL programming/tuning and development


o System level metrics and ability to create custom ones


o Automation tasks/scripts


o Strong backup/restore and HA and failover experience


§ And, any equivalent combination of education, experience, certificates, and training that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities will be considered

  


EXPERIENCE


8-11 Years
SKILLS


Primary Skill: Database Administrator
Sub Skill(s): Oracle DBA
Additional Skill(s): SQL Server DBA, Azure SQL DBA
ABOUT THE COMPANY


Infogain is a human-centered digital platform and software engineering company based out of Silicon Valley. We engineer business outcomes for Fortune 500 companies and digital natives in the technology, healthcare, insurance, travel, telecom, and retail & CPG industries using technologies such as cloud, microservices, automation, IoT, and artificial intelligence. We accelerate experience-led transformation in the delivery of digital platforms. Infogain is also a Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT) Gold Partner and Azure Expert Managed Services Provider (MSP).



Infogain, an Apax Funds portfolio company, has offices in California, Washington, Texas, the UK, the UAE, and Singapore, with delivery centers in Seattle, Houston, Austin, Kraków, Noida, Gurgaon, Mumbai, Pune, and Bengaluru.

description:
Overview:
**Job Title- Oracle EBS Apps DBA****Experiences-4- 7 Years****Job Location: Noida/Gurugram/Pune/Mumbai (****Customer Location)****Notice Period-Immediate-15 days.**
Responsibilities:
**Job Description:*** Support and Maintenance of Oracle E-Business Suite (EBS) R12 Applications.
* Daily support and management of Oracle E-business Suite Application support activities.
* Monitoring and Trouble-shooting issues related to E-Business Suite Application Servers and services.

* Monitoring the Concurrent Managers status and managing the operations like starting, stopping the concurrent managers, re-schedule the requests and purging the concurrent requests historical data.
* Managing Concurrent queues and Parallel Concurrent Processing.
* Administration and Management of EBS External applications like iSupplier Module on DMZ.
* Java upgrades on EBS Application Servers and involve in Browser testing for Java desktop updates.
* Creating Severity TARs/SR and conduct OWC sessions with Oracle support to resolve issues.
* Cloning Oracle E-Business Suite Application from Prod to Non-Prod Environments using Rapid and manual clone process.
* Multi Node to Multi Node, Multi Node to Single node and adding additional Application nodes if required.
* EBS Application Code Migrations from Development to QA, UAT and Production Instances.
* Coordinate and work with Release/Change Management teams for deployments, Outages and code migrations across Prod and Non-Prod Environments
* Track Security Certificate expirations and request new certificates for EBS Applications.

 **Mandatory Skills:*** Typically, 4 to 7 years of experience With Oracle EBS, WebLogic Middleware and Single Sign-On Administration
* Full Understanding of the Oracle E-Business Suite R12 architecture and processes with their individual configuration files & log files to trouble shoot issues with each component.
* Hands on experience in Maintenance and Configuration of E-business R12 environment.
* Troubleshooting, Monitoring, Performance tuning of E-business Application Servers and services.
* Hands on experience in supporting EBS Financial Modules like AP, AR and GL Products.
* Sound Knowledge on troubleshooting issues related to Apache, oacore, oafm, oc4j, Forms services and apps login through SSO.
* Expertise in Application Cloning using Rapid Clone Utility/manual cloning and troubleshooting post clone issues
* Cloning Oracle E-Business Suite Application from Prod to Non-Prod, Multi Node to Multi Node, Multi Node to single node and adding additional Application nodes.
* Configure and manage Parallel Concurrent Processing
* Configure PGP Encryption, SSH Keys exchange for File transfers and Bank interfaces.
* Hands on experience in configuring and supporting EBS Multi-node architecture for High availability.
* Configuration of Workflow Mailers and Troubleshooting workflow notification mailer issues.
* Hands on experience in WebLogic Installation and configuration, Administration and Performance tuning.
* Configuration and monitoring EBS Application through OEM.
* Enabling SSL or TLS in Oracle E-Business Suite Release 12 and import the security certificates.
* Performing Oracle Application Pre-patch analysis (Using Patch Wizard in Oracle Applications Manager), Pre-config Analysis for Quarterly PSU and other required patches.
* Applying Oracle E-Business Suite Application patches (PSU, One-off, Mini Pack, Family Pack) using adpatch options.
* Proficient in Administration and management of Oracle E-Business suite using AD and FND utilities that include adadmin, adconfig, adpatch, adlicmgr, adsplice, adident, adctrl, adsplice, FNDCPASS, FNDLOAD, FRMCMP etc.

-------------------

**Backup Engineer**  

  

**Responsibilities:****Overview** - You will be working with Engineering, Delivery Engineers/Specialist, System Engineers/Specialist, and Managed Services Provider (MSP) to build out professional services practices (installation, integration, applications, migration, scripting) to be used by Standard Chartered Bank. **Key Skill:*** Cohesity Backup Technology hands on experience in implementing from scratch
* Well versed with backup technologies like Netbackup or Networker
* Understands the technical complexities in managing backup infrastructure

 **Implementation*** Collaboration with MSP and internal ITSM for Cohesity project delivery
* Act as implementation focal point for key / high-profile implementations
* Cohesity System Installation

 **Development & Documentation*** Write and validate the implementation/integration best practices
* Develop pre-installation survey and planning documents to prepare for install
* Develop workflows to validate implementations
* Develop sample post deployment documentation
* Provide feedback to engineering on ways to improve the implementation experience

 **Knowledge Sharing*** Convert best practices into a training curriculum
* Deliver hands-on training in small-group formats
* Mentor trainees in the field

 **Qualifications:*** Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent experience
* Minimum 4 years IT experience
* Experience in these technical areas is required
* Operating Systems – Linux, Windows
* Data Protection
* Server Virtualization (VMware, Hyper-V, Nutanix)
* Oracle, SQL, Data Migration
* BIOS level bootstrap OS installation
* Disks – SSD NVME, HDD, SSD M2
* 10 Gb Network cabling
* Basic TCP/IP Networking – IPv4, DNS, NTP, Firewalls
* Additional experience in these areas is highly desirable:
* Public Cloud Infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP)
* Public Cloud Storage (AWS S3, AWS Glacier, Azure Blob)
* Network Attached Storage
* Advanced Networking – IPv6, LACP, Tagged VLANs
* Disaster Recovery/Business Continuance
* Data Replication
* Data De-duplication
* Other Database Types - Protection and Recovery
* Scripting (bash, Python, PowerShell)
* Automation using REST API
* Technical drawings using Visio or equivalent application
* Hardware experience with qualified vendor systems: Cisco, Dell, IBM, Oracle
* Excellent communication and project-related skills are also required
* Strong verbal communication/presentation skills
* Strong written skills and the ability to create documentation
* The ability to teach others and make them successful
* Self-starter with excellent organization and time management skills
* The ability to manage projects and to drive to a deadline

title: Operations Analyst
description:
In a world of disruption and increasingly complex business challenges, our professionals bring truth into focus with the Kroll Lens. Our sharp analytical skills, paired with the latest technology, allow us to give our clients clarity—not just answers—in all areas of business. We value the diverse backgrounds and perspectives that enable us to think globally. As part of *One team, One Kroll*, you’ll contribute to a supportive and collaborative work environment that empowers you to excel.



Kroll Settlement Administration, part of Kroll’s Business Services division, is the leader in cutting-edge technology and consulting services for class action, mass tort, regulatory remediation and government claims administration. With 50+ years of legal administration expertise, we offer unmatched solutions and capacity for even the most complex settlements anywhere in the world.



As a settlement administrator, we are responsible for notifying potential class members, reviewing and processing claim forms filed by individuals and entities, calculating losses, auditing claims to determine the extent of the damages incurred and processing and distributing funds to eligible class members under the court’s direction. As part of Kroll, we employ nearly 5,000 professionals in 30 countries and territories around the world.



We are looking for a Junior Data Analyst to join our growing team. The ideal candidate should have experience in SQL, data reporting skills, form building, and performing data quality checks on peer work. In this role, you will be responsible for managing data in our databases, writing SQL queries to import, clean, and update data, preparing data reports using SQL or Python, building forms in Power BI, and performing data quality checks on peer work.



At Kroll, your work will help deliver clarity to our clients’ most complex governance, risk and transparency challenges. Apply now to join *One team, One Kroll*.


**Responsibilities:**


* A highly motivated team player and an organized, strategic thinker who is passionate about data.
* Fast learner, able to master new concepts, theories, ideas, and processes with ease.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with clear attention to detail.
* Be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment.
* Ability to prioritize and work under tight deadlines.
* Willingness to work beyond traditional working hours/days as required by the business.
* The person should be open to learning and take new responsibilities.
* Keen sense of teamwork, both within the team and collaborating with other teams.
* Ability to see opportunities to automate mundane tasks and write scripts when necessary.
* Work with team members to develop data solutions that support business needs.
* Manage data in databases and ensure data quality and integrity.
* Write SQL queries to import, clean, and update data.
* Analyze data and develop reports to support business decision-making.
* Develop and maintain data dashboards and visualizations.
* Automate data processes and improve efficiency.
* Participate in data modeling and database design.
* Collaborate with other departments to ensure data accuracy and completeness.
* Perform data quality checks on peer work.
* Monitor data trends and identify areas for improvement.
* Assist with data migration and system integration projects.


**Requirements:**


* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics or related field.
* Knowledge of SQL and experience with SQL databases such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, or Oracle.
* Familiarity with data reporting tools such as PowerBI, Tableau or Google Data Studio.
* Experience using Python for data analysis and manipulation is a plus.
* Familiarity with web technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
* Knowledge of XML and XForms for building and processing web forms is a plus.
* Understanding of web services, including RESTful web services and SOAP web services, so a programmer should have experience working with these technologies is a plus.
* Ability to manage confidential, sensitive information.


To be considered for a position at Kroll, you must formally apply via careers.kroll.jobs


*Kroll is committed to equal opportunity and diversity, and recruits people based on merit*

title: Senior Information Security Analyst
description:
**Job Title: Senior Information Security Analyst**  

  

**Team: Platform Provisioning - Database**  

  

**About Wells Fargo**: Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE: WFC) is a diversified, community-based financial services company with $2.0 trillion in assets. Founded in 1852 and headquartered in San Francisco, Wells Fargo provides banking, insurance, investments, mortgage, and consumer and commercial finance through more than 8,500 locations, 13,000 ATMs, the internet (wellsfargo.com) and mobile banking, and has offices in 42 countries and territories to support customers who conduct business in the global economy. With approximately 273,000 team members, Wells Fargo serves one in three households in the United States. Wells Fargo & Company was ranked No. 25 on Fortune's 2017 rankings of America's largest corporations. Wells Fargo's vision is to satisfy our customers' financial needs and help them succeed financially. News, insights and perspectives from Wells Fargo are also available at Wells Fargo Stories.  

  

**About Enterprise Global Services**:  

  

Enterprise Global Services (EGS) enables global talent capabilities for Wells Fargo Bank NA., by supporting over half of Wells Fargo's business lines and staff functions across Technology, Operations, Risk Services and Knowledge Services. EGS operates in Hyderabad, Bengaluru and Chennai in India and in Manila, Philippines. Learn more about EGS at our International Careers website .  

  

**Department Overview**:  

Wells Fargo views information security as enabling lines of business to mitigate information security risk in accordance with our risk appetite. Through a framework that addresses policy, process, operations, people, and technology, Information Security protects our infrastructure, company data, and customer assets while ensuring alignment with applicable regulations and laws.
  

  

Our vision is to provide Wells Fargo with world-leading cyber security risk management.  

  

**About the role:**  

  

Information Security organization has a new opportunity on the Enterprise Access Management team for an Senior Information Security Analyst to support the daily production for Database Security and Access Management services related to provisioning, de-provisioning and certifications.  

  

**Job Description:**  

  

Provides access management within Database Security and Access Management team. Provisions and de-provisions Database Platform requests submitted through various request methods.  

  

**Job Responsibilities:*** Owns, tracks and resolves database related incidents tickets submitted to Enterprise Access Management in the PAC2000 tool.
* Provides basic and complex technical support for routine security-related issues.
* Owns, tracks and resolves database related project requests.
* Responds to Database related alerts and escalations during business hours; participates in a rotation schedule for providing after business hours support working with fellow Database Information Security Analysts, Database Administrators or Engineering staff to come up with strategic solutions to recurring problems.
* Provides work direction, guidance and/or subject matter expertise to less experienced Database team members.
* Performs periodic review of existing documentation to ensure current understanding of processes and procedures making updates/changes as necessary.
* Able to support and lead the team independently

**Required** **Qualifications:*** Bachelor of Engineering Degree, preferably of Computer science or Information Technology
* 4+ years hands on experience on provisioning on Databases. Experienced on managing access, roles and security of databases.
* Must have strong knowledge in/or SQL, Oracle, Teradata, Sybase and DB2 platforms
* Must have hands-on experience on/or SQL Server Management Studio, SQL Developer, Teradata SQL Assistant, Sybase ASE, DB2
* Must any one Database Administration/Information Security certification (Security +, CISSP, CIAM) /IAM vendor based certifications (Cyberark, Oracle, IBM) certified.
* Knowledge and experience with any IAM, Provisioning, role management and certification tool
* Knowledge and experience on Applications Infrastructure in a Large Enterprise environment.
* Strong knowledge and understanding of information security and IAM practices and policies
* Experience with Service Delivery and SLAs/KPIs monitoring. Proven ability for high volume/high quality results
* Ability to interact with integrity and a high level of professionalism with all levels of team members and management
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills; clear verbal and written communication skills to facilitate solutions and resolve problems
* Flexible to work in shifts and be available for business meetings/team deliverables outside of ones shift
* Proven ability to collaborate effectively with different teams initiate action, manage change, contribute to high impact decisions and accept challenging assignments. Able to foster robust working relationships with team
* Must have troubleshooting skills over Database platforms, Database User Administration and SQL Queries
* Must have understanding and working on any Access Management generic Tools
* Strong knowledge on Change and Incident management on any Ticketing Tool
* Ability to identify and contribute towards mitigating risk
* Ability to manage the bridge calls with customers on technical issues/pages/ On-Calls
* Participates in the evaluation, development, testing and implementation of emerging data access control technologies, information systems security issues, safeguards and
* Provides support for testing, emergencies, installations, and conversions. Provides assistance in audit compliance projects
* May participate in security investigations
* Must have ability to identify opportunities for process improvement
* Ability to assign BAU tasks to Team members and drive it till closure. Ability to analyze and summarize data, do trend analysis and reporting
* Must have leadership skills, to be resilient and drive changes. Ability to maintain composure under pressure and deadlines in a dynamic environment

**Desired Qualifications:*** Knowledge in Windows Server and Shell Scripting (Bash, Korn, C, Powershell)
* Must have understanding of data analysis techniques, standards and error handling concepts
* Must have mentoring skills to help the team be successful

**Posting End Date:**
  

21 Mar 2024  

**\\*Job posting may come down early due to volume of applicants.**
  

  

**We Value Diversity**  

  

At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, individuals with disabilities, pregnancy, marital status, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable law.  

  

Employees support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business unit's risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements.  

  

Candidates applying to job openings posted in US: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other legally protected characteristic.  

  

Candidates applying to job openings posted in Canada: Applications for employment are encouraged from all qualified candidates, including women, persons with disabilities, aboriginal peoples and visible minorities. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available upon request in connection with the recruitment process.  

  

**Applicants with Disabilities**  

  

To request a medical accommodation during the application or interview process, visit Disability Inclusion at Wells Fargo .  

  

**Drug and Alcohol Policy**  

  

Wells Fargo maintains a drug free workplace. Please see our Drug and Alcohol Policy to learn more.

title: Support Practitioner
description:
**Project Role :** Infra Tech Support Practitioner  

**Project Role Description :** Provide ongoing technical support and maintenance of production and development systems and software products (both remote and onsite) and for configured services running on various platforms (operating within a defined operating model and processes). Provide hardware/software support and implement technology at the operating system-level across all server and network areas, and for particular software solutions/vendors/brands. Work includes L1 and L2/ basic and intermediate level troubleshooting.
  

**Must have skills :** Oracle Database Administration  

**Good to have skills :** NA  

Minimum **3** year(s) of experience is required  

**Educational Qualification :** Graduate  

  

Summary: We are seeking an experienced Oracle Database Administrator (DBA) with a minimum of 4+ years of hands-on experience to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Oracle database management and administration, as well as expertise in optimizing database performance, ensuring data integrity, Performance Tuning and providing support for mission-critical applications. Designs, builds, tests, and deploys cloud application solutions that integrate cloud and non-cloud infrastructure. Can deploy infrastructure and platform environments, creates a proof of architecture to test architecture viability, security and performance. Roles & Responsibilities: Database Administration: • Installation, configuration, patching, upgrade and maintaining Oracle database and RAC systems. • Perform regular database backups and ensure data recovery procedures are in place. • Managing database RAC environments. • Excellent skills in Oracle RDBMS/RAC architecture concepts and good exposure on oracle 11g/12c/19c • Monitor database performance and optimize query execution. • Implement and maintain security measures to safeguard data. • Schema/User, profile management, Storage structure, Tablespaces management. • Oracle network configuration • Database Lifecycle Management - Database creation, setup & decommissioning. • Database event/ monitoring, space management, user management • Database upgrades, migrations, and cloning. • Oracle DB installation, DB refresh, DB upgrade, DB decommissions, Patching. • Backup and recovery, RMAN, DATAPUMP, DATAGUARD • Apply patches and Patching (DB and client), as needed to keep the database environment up to date. • Resolve performance tuning issues, Generating & reviewing AWR reports. • Monitoring, back up/ Recovery Management, DB Provisioning/de-provisioning, DB refresh/restore, HA/DRE, migration, replication, and upgrades. • Implement security and policies. Professional & Technical Skills: • Must Have Skills: Strong knowledge of Oracle Database Administration. • Good To Have Skills: Experience with other database technologies like MSSQL Server, MongoDB, MySQL, PostgreSQL etc. • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience). • Minimum of 4 years of hands-on experience as an Oracle Database Administrator. • Strong proficiency in Oracle Database administration, including Oracle 12c, 19c, or later versions. • Experience in Data guard management. • Good to have knowledge on Goldengate • Proven experience in database upgrade and patch management. • Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills. • Knowledge of backup and recovery strategies. • Familiarity with database security best practices. • Experience with database auditing and reporting. • Understanding of change management, problem management, and incident management processes. • Proven experience in database migration projects. • Strong communication and interpersonal skills. • Excellent work experience as an "Oracle Database Admin” • Strong understanding of Oracle Architecture • Auditing and reporting experience. • Experience in reporting and communicating with Oracle or vendor support. • Working experience with ticketing tools. • Working knowledge of ITIL process. Additional Information: • Experience to lead a team. • Additionally, experience with other database platforms such as MSSQL Server, MongoDB, MySQL, and PostgreSQL are a plus.


  

Graduate

description:
ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES


**Job Description: L2 Support**

Provides telephone support to end-users on hardware, XStore , ORPOS software and other store system related issues. Tracks, takes ownership of issues, Resolves issues and promotes end-user satisfaction; tracks activities of technical support specialists to whom tickets were assigned. Works with Level 3 and other escalation points to resolve technical issues. Provides Remote Access Support through various VPN connections. Provides a high level of customer service in a fast-paced environment with phone calls, emails, and messaging. Follows up with existing tickets/inquiries, as appropriate. Accurately classifies and records details of inquiries into a web-based ticketing system. Effectively manages/prioritizes time to ensure that minimum Service Levels are met and/or exceeded.


Must Have:


? Strong team player Excellent written and verbal communication skills.


? The ability to learn quickly and independently.


? Be passionate about helping people and resolving issues.


? Initiative to use available solution articles and resources to solve problems and take ownership of ticketed issues.

? Strong interpersonal skills are required. Ability to understand that user s needs are just as important as uncovering the technical solution.

? Troubleshooting skills required.

Good to Have :

4.5-6 Years

ABOUT THE COMPANY


Infogain is a human-centered digital platform and software engineering company based out of Silicon Valley. We engineer business outcomes for Fortune 500 companies and digital natives in the technology, healthcare, insurance, travel, telecom, and retail & CPG industries using technologies such as cloud, microservices, automation, IoT, and artificial intelligence. We accelerate experience-led transformation in the delivery of digital platforms. Infogain is also a Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT) Gold Partner and Azure Expert Managed Services Provider (MSP).



Infogain, an Apax Funds portfolio company, has offices in California, Washington, Texas, the UK, the UAE, and Singapore, with delivery centers in Seattle, Houston, Austin, Kraków, Noida, Gurgaon, Mumbai, Pune, and Bengaluru.

title: Salesforce Administrator
description:
### **Job Information**


Work Experience


**4-5 years**City


**New Delhi**State/Province


**Delhi**Country


**India**Zip/Postal Code


**110015**### **About us**


Posist is a leading cloud-based restaurant technology platform that powers over 20,000 restaurants in 50+ countries. It allows enterprise restaurant operators to grow at scale, improve bottom-line efficiency, and deliver a consistent guest experience. Posist's unified technology platform empowers restaurants with a full-stack cloud, including Point of Sale (POS), Inventory Management, Integrations, Analytics, and CRM. Renowned restaurant chains, including Subway, Taco Bell, Nando’s, Caribou Coffee, Carl’s Jr., and Häagen-Dazs, are among the many brands using Posist to manage their processes, people, and places of operation.

  

Posist has been awarded as a global leader in Restaurant Management Software by G2 and recognized as a Great Place to Work-Certified™ organization.

  

To know more, visit www.posist.com  

### **Job Description**


### **This role is ideal for an experienced salesforce professional who is looking to take their skills to the next level. The successful candidate will have a track record of success in sales operations and a strong understanding of the salesforce platform. They will be highly organized and analytical, with excellent communication and project management skills.**
**Responsibilities:**

* Maintain and optimize the salesforce platform to ensure that it is aligned with the company’s sales process and goals
* Act as the primary point of contact for sales reps and managers regarding salesforce and provide training and support as needed
* Analyze sales data and provide insights and recommendations to the sales and management teams
* Work with the sales and marketing teams to create and maintain reports, dashboards, and other salesforce-related tools
* Managing salesforce roles, profiles, sharing rules, workflows, and groups
* Importing sales department leads, contacts, and other data
* Performing database maintenance tasks, including diagnostic tests and duplicate entry cleansing
* Collaborate with other departments, such as customer service and technical support, to ensure a positive customer experience and to address any issues that may arise
* Manage and maintain salesforce data integrity by regularly auditing and cleaning the CRM data
* System Integration: Collaborate with IT teams to integrate salesforce analytics CRM with other systems and applications, such as marketing automation tools (Hub spot), document signing software (DocuSign), gmail, video conferencing (Zoom), and tele calling tools, accounting software (Zoho Books) among others
* Documentation and Documentation: Maintain accurate documentation of system configurations, processes, and workflows. Create user manuals, training materials, and standard operating procedures (SOPs) to ensure consistent usage and knowledge sharing

### **Requirements**

* Proven experience in salesforce administration, with a strong understanding of its capabilities and limitations
* Strong analytical skills and experience with data analysis tools
* Excellent communication and project management skills
* Proven ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams
* Strong understanding of the sales process and experience in sales operations is a plus
* Salesforce certification is a plus

### **Benefits**

* Get your hands on one of the best restaurant SaaS products
* Work with 18,000+ happy brands in 50 countries
* Be a part of a small & friendly team of marketers
* Open and transparent work culture
